definition[0]: if soldiers fall back, they move back because they are being attacked
example[0]: He yelled for his men to fall back.
definition[1]: to move backwards because you are very surprised, frightened etc
example[1]: Scott fell back a pace in astonishment.
example[2]: When inflation started to rise, house prices fell back.
definition[3]: if prices on a financial market fall back, they go down after a period of time when they have been going up
example[3]: In Tokyo, stocks fell back from early gains.
